DOCNAME: CASE OF TOIVE LEHTINEN v. FINLAND (NO. 2)
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was the principal partner in a construction company , GPE ( limited partnership ) , which was wound - up in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( hereinafter “ SSP ” ) initiated civil proceedings to enforce various debts against the applicant . The applicant was summoned on CARDINAL DATE . Subsequently the applicant filed a counter - claim , which was eventually joined to the original claim on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . DATE and CARDINAL DATE a total of CARDINAL preparatory hearings and CARDINAL main hearings were organised .

CARDINAL . During the same period ORG issued CARDINAL partial decisions . The decisions concerned requests to grant the applicant free legal aid , to dismiss the opposing legal counsel , to declare the trial material classified , to declare one claim inadmissible , to relieve the applicant ’s counsel of his tasks and to order the claimant to provide certain documents as evidence .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG gave its judgment , ordering the applicant to pay CARDINAL ( ORG ) with interest to ORG and dismissing all of the applicant ’s counter - claims .

CARDINAL . In his appeal the applicant challenged the judgment in its entirety as well as the earlier decisions of ORG not to dismiss the opposing counsel and the refusal to order the claimant to produce certain documents as evidence . He requested that the case be remitted to ORG and that an oral hearing be held before ORG ( hovioikeus , hovrätten ) with regard to the missing documents or DATE if the case was not remitted – with regard to the entire case . He further requested that he be exempted from paying ORG ’s legal fees or at least the value - added tax ( VAT ) on the fees . He also requested reimbursement of his own legal fees .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG remitted the case to ORG , ordering ORG to provide CARDINAL specified documents ( TIME from various board meetings ) at the hearing before ORG and allowing the applicant to provide some additional evidence which had previously been refused by ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP The proceedings became pending before ORG on DATE . DATE and DATE a total of CARDINAL preparatory hearings and CARDINAL main hearings were organised .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered ORG to provide various additional documents , including the above - mentioned ones . All but CARDINAL of the requested documents were provided on DATE . The missing documents were no longer in the possession of ORG or they had not been found .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided on the case for the second time , finding that the examination of the previously presented evidence , the new evidence and the new hearing of all the witnesses did not give rise to any new conclusions . The judgment was essentially the same as the CARDINAL given in the first set of proceedings .

CARDINAL . In his appeal the applicant requested that the judgment be quashed , that an oral hearing be held , and that he be exempted from paying ORG ’s legal fees or at least the VAT thereon . He also requested reimbursement of his own legal fees . In the addendum to his appeal he requested ORG to order the missing documents to be provided and to remit the case again to ORG since the judgment did not specify the new evidence nor address the issue of changed witness statements . He also claimed that the judge had been biased .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request to have the case remitted again to ORG and held that it was plausible that the missing documents were not in the possession of ORG . It further found that the judge in question had not been biased and that there was no indication that the new evidence had not been taken into consideration . In regard to the latter , ORG added that , in any event , the relevant witnesses would be heard again .

CARDINAL . After having held an oral hearing over DATE ORG upheld the decision of ORG on DATE . The applicant was exempted from paying ORG on the legal fees incurred before ORG , but the court held that since he had not requested an exemption before ORG , the exemption did not apply to legal fees incurred at that stage .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( korkein oikeus , högsta domstolen ) granted leave to appeal with regard to the issue of exemption from the payment of GPE on the legal fees incurred before ORG . Leave to appeal was refused as regards the remainder of the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave its judgment on the VAT exemption .
